column5: Hello all. Due to a wedding next year, we may be looking at a shortened trip, if anything at all. We typically all meet in Chicago and drive the 15 hours up to Lac Seul, but that would be too much for a 3-4 day trip. We would all be taking off from Grand Rapids, MI next year. Has anyone had a lot of success with walleye on lakes just north of Michigan? Ideally the trip would be less than 8 hours from Grand Rapids. Thanks!

It is about 7 1/2 hours to Wawa Ontario from Grand Rapids where you could hook up with Airdale Fly In Lodges. They have a main lodge there and also do fly in trips to remote lakes. Depending on the time of year you would be going, they may offer 3-4 day trips. The drive along the North Shore of Lake Superior is gorgeous . I'm heading up that way at the end of September and can't wait. Best of luck finding a great place to go. PjShorthorn

Look at Lake Anjigami (sp??) up near WaWa. Drive in where we rented the whole camp (20 of us from our church group) Caught and ate a ton of fish. There were two other lakes you could portage too to catch pike. dvl2700
I am also looking for somewhere in late sept solo not too far from the Soo. Anyone ever fish at Brennan Harbor in Spanish or other ideas?
